Description: Lower body sherd of Chian wide-bodied Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black (fired red in places); reserved dot at bottom; exterior: parts of four black rays; below, wide black band at junction of chalice and foot; three (and parts of two more) drill holes near bottom of sherd.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the pattern decoration, see Lemos 1991, pl. 80, no. 624.
The repair holes are curiously distant from breaks - designed to reattach foot?
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0244) (phase 2)
